poem:
### On Reading a Recipe for Slow-Cooked Lamb

In the cool hush of morning,  
lamb settles into the oven's embrace,  
a gentle anticipation rising,  
while the house dreams in garlicky clouds.  
Salsa joins in the fragrant waltz—  
tomatoes and herbs, a quiet minuet.  
Only time and warmth conspire,  
and by evening,  
a silence broken by satisfied sighs.
